alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"... At present it seems difficult to assess the merits of these ideas because of the lack of any quantitative estimates of some of the factors that, according to his views, must be involved. It is pertinent to note, in this connection, that there are still many unsettled questions concerning the lightning storms that occur only a few miles above our heads in our own atmosphere."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Sydney Chapman on Charles Bruce - Part 3
